text:
Hacène Lalmas (12 March 1943 – 7 July 2018) was an Algerian footballer. He played as a midfielder and was nicknamed El Kebch (The Ram). Lalmas was born in Algiers, Algeria. He played for OM Ruisseau from 1954 to 1962, CR Belouizdad from 1962 to 1973, NA Hussein Dey from 1973 to 1975 and for Algeria national football team from 1963 to 1974.
Lalmas died in Algiers on 7 July 2018 from an aortic dissection at the age of 75.
